DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: CARRARA, S. L. A.;Carrara, Sidney L. A.;S. Carrara;S. L. Carrara;S. L. A. Carrara;Sidney L. A. Carrara;Sidney Carrara;Alessi Carrara, Sidney L.;CARRARA, S.;CARRARA, S.L.A.;CARRARA, SIDNEY LUIZ ALESSI

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Engenheiro Eletrônico pelo Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (ITA-1982), com mestrado (1984) e doutorado (1989) em Electrical Engineering - Stanford University. Atualmente é Diretor de Projetos da FUNCATE - Fundação de Ciência, Aplicações e Tecnologia Espaciais, e Professor - Faculdade de Tecnologia - FATEC-SJC. Tem experiência na área de Engenharia Elétrica, com ênfase em Teoria Eletromagnetica, Propagação de Ondas, Opto-Eletrônica, Circuitos Eletrônicos, Gerenciamento de Projetos, atuando principalmente em sistemas espaciais, equipamentos eletrônicos e opto-eletrônicos de alta confiabilidade, e sensores e dispositivos a fibras ópticas.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Electronics Engineer (Technological Institute of Aeronautics, ITA, 1982, Summa cum Laude), MS (1984) and Ph.D. (1989) in Electrical Engineering (Stanford University). Currently Project Director at FUNCATE - Foundation for Space Science, Applications and Technology, and Professor at FATEC-SJC (São Paulo State Technology University), both in São José dos Campos, SP, Brazil. Over 35 years experience in Electrical Engineering, with emphasis on electromagnetic theory, wave propagation, optoelectronics, electronic circuits, and project management, especially in space systems, high-reliabiliy electronic and optoelectronic equipment, and optical fiber devices and sensors.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Fiber optic rotation sensor utilizing high birefringence fiber and having reduced intensity type phase errors

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Fiber optic rotation sensor utilizing high birefringence fiber and having reduced intensity type phase errors
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: United States Patent and Trademark Office
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.NOME-DO-DEPOSITANTE: The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior Universi;Stanford University

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A fiber optic rotation sensor using birefringent optical fiber includes an uncorrelating element, an equalizing element and a polarizer in the common input and output fiber portions of the sensor to reduce or eliminate the intensity type phase errors caused by interference between lightwaves originally in the same polarization mode on entry to the sensor loop that cross couple into another polarization mode. In the preferred embodiment, the uncorrelating element comprises a birefringence modulator and a length of birefringent fiber. The equalizing element comprises a birefringent fiber having a splice at which the axes of birefringence of the spliced portions of the fiber are positioned at 45° relative to each other. The preferred embodiment also advantageously includes a birefringence modulator that introduces a time-varying birefringence into the optical fiber to introduce a deterministic phase error that reduces or eliminates amplitude type phase error caused by coherent interference between field components of light that are orthogonally polarized at the input of the sensor loop and that couple to the same polarization mode within the loop.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: SENSOR POR DEFORMAÇÃO DE FIBRA ÓPTICA BIMODAL

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: SENSOR POR DEFORMAÇÃO DE FIBRA ÓPTICA BIMODAL
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.INSTITUICAO-DEPOSITO-REGISTRO: INPI - Instituto Nacional da Propriedade Industrial
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.NOME-DO-DEPOSITANTE: Centro Tecnico Aeroespacial;Departamento de Ciência e Tecnologia Aeroespacial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: BIMODALRefere-se a presente a um sistema interferométrico a fibra bimodal, onde perturbações externas à fibra causam um atraso diferencial de fase entre os modos guiados, constituindo-se em um sensor para a medida das grandezas físicas que causam tais perturbações, sendo por isso aplicável como instrumento de medição de alta precisão.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-PATENTE.TITULO: Apparatus and method for determining the orientation of axes of birefringence in an optical fiber.

REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.TITULO-PATENTE: Apparatus and method for determining the orientation of axes of birefringence in an optical fiber.
REGISTRO-OU-PATENTE.NOME-DO-DEPOSITANTE: The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior Universi;Stanford University

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An apparauts and process for accurate alignament of the birefrigent axes of circular fibers, and differentiation between the fast and slow axes utilizing an externally induced stress birefringence to change the orientation and magnitude of the natural fiber birefringence at a selected point along the length of the fiber (24) is disclosed. The apparatus comprises a light source (60) for supplying polarized light to the fiber (24), means (66, 68) for inducing stress to the fiber at that point in a variable direction and means (78) for monitoring the effect on the light as that direction is varied. A measurement of coupling from one polarization mode of the fiber to the othe as the axis of induced stress is changed provides an accurate determination of the lacation of the birefringent axes of the fiber (24).
